textfilecontent54_test.comment: Ensurefile(s) named ^.+$ in /etc/yum.repos.d exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*gpgcheck\h*=\h*(0|[2-9]|[1-9][0-9]+|false|no)\b
Ensurefile(s) named ^.+$ in /etc/yum.repos.d exists and matches pattern ^gpgcheck\h*=\h*0\b
Ensurefile(s) named ^.+$ in /etc/sudoers.d/ exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*([^#\n\r]+\h+)?\!authenticate\b(\.*)?$
Ensure no file(s) named ^.+\.conf$ in /etc/sudoers.d/ exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*defaults\h+(?:[^#\n\r]+\h*,\h*)?timestamp_timeout=(-1|1[6-9]|[2-9][0-9]|[1-9][0-9][0-9]+)\b(\h*,\h*.*)?$
Ensure at least one file(s) named ^.+\.sh$ in /etc/profile.d/ exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*UMASK\h+(0[0-7][2-7]7|[0-7][2-7]7|u=(r?|w?|x?)(r?|w?|x?)(r?|w?|x?),g=(r?x?|x?r?),o=)(\h+.*)?$
Ensure at least one file(s) named .*\.conf in /etc/rsyslog.d/ exists and matches pattern ^\s*\$FileCreateMode\s+0[6420][40]0\s*(\s+#.*)?$
Ensurefile(s) named .*\.conf in /etc/rsyslog.d/ exists and matches pattern ^\s*\*\.\*\s+@
Ensure at least one file named /etc/dnf/dnf.conf exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*gpgcheck\h*=\h*(1|true|yes)\b
Ensure no file named /etc/dnf/dnf.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*gpgcheck\h*=\h*(0|[2-9]|[1-9][0-9]+|false|no)\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/tdnf/tdnf.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*gpgcheck\h*=\h*1\h*$
Ensure no file named /etc/tdnf/tdnf.conf exists and matches pattern ^gpgcheck\h*=\h*0\h*(\h+.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/issue exists and matches pattern ^.+$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/issue.net exists and matches pattern ^.+$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/chrony.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*(server|pool|refclock)\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/sysconfig/chronyd exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*OPTIONS\h*=\h*"([^"#\n\r]+\h+)?-u\h_?chrony\b

file_test.comment: Ensure at least one file named /etc/crontab exists and is owned by 0:0 and does not have permissions ---rwxrwx
Ensure no file named /etc/crontab exists and unknown test
Ensure at least one file named /etc/cron.hourly/ exists and is owned by 0:0 and does not have permissions ---rwxrwx
Ensure at least one file named /etc/cron.daily/ exists and is owned by 0:0 and does not have permissions ---rwxrwx
Ensure at least one file named /etc/cron.weekly/ exists and is owned by 0:0 and does not have permissions ---rwxrwx
Ensure at least one file named /etc/cron.monthly/ exists and is owned by 0:0 and does not have permissions ---rwxrwx
Ensure at least one file named /etc/cron.d/ exists and is owned by 0:0 and does not have permissions ---rwxrwx
Ensure no file named /etc/cron.deny exists and unknown test
Ensure at least one file named /etc/cron.deny exists and is owned by 0:0 and does not have permissions --x-wxrwx
Ensure package name equals 'cronie' is not installed
Ensure no file named /etc/at.deny exists and unknown test
Ensure at least one file named /etc/at.allow exists and is owned by 0:0 and does not have permissions --xrwxrwx

textfilecontent54_test.comment: Ensure no file named /etc/sudoers exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*([^#\n\r]+\h+)?\!authenticate\b(\.*)?$
Ensure no file named /etc/sudoers exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*defaults\h+(?:[^#\n\r]+\h*,\h*)?timestamp_timeout=(-1|1[6-9]|[2-9][0-9]|[1-9][0-9][0-9]+)\b(\h*,\h*.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/pwquality.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*minlen\h*=\h*(1[4-9]|[2-9][0-9]|[1-9][0-9]{2,})\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-password exists and matches pattern ^\h*password\h+([^#\n\r]+\h+)?pam_pwquality\.so\h+([^#\n\r]+\h+)?(retry=[1-3])\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-auth exists and matches pattern ^\h*password\h+([^#\n\r]+\h+)?pam_pwquality\.so\h+([^#\n\r]+\h+)?(retry=[1-3])\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/pwquality.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*dcredit\h*=\h*-([1-9]|[1-9][0-9])+\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/pwquality.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*ucredit\h*=\h*-([1-9]|[1-9][0-9])+\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/pwquality.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*ocredit\h*=\h*-([1-9]|[1-9][0-9])+\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/pwquality.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*lcredit\h*=\h*-([1-9]|[1-9][0-9])+\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/pwquality.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*minclass\h*=\h*([1-9][0-9]+|[4-9])\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-auth exists and matches pattern ^\h*auth\h+([^#\n\r]+)\h+pam_faillock\.so([^#\n\r]+\h+)?deny=[1-5]\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-password exists and matches pattern ^\h*auth\h+([^#\n\r]+)\h+pam_faillock\.so([^#\n\r]+\h+)?deny=[1-5]\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-auth exists and matches pattern ^\h*auth\h+([^#\n\r]+)\h+pam_faillock\.so([^#\n\r]+\h+)?unlock_time=(0|9[0-9]{2}|[1-9][0-9]{3,})\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-password exists and matches pattern ^\h*auth\h+([^#\n\r]+)\h+pam_faillock\.so([^#\n\r]+\h+)?unlock_time=(0|9[0-9]{2}|[1-9][0-9]{3,})\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-auth exists and matches pattern ^\h*account\h+([^#\n\r]+)\h+pam_faillock\.so\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-password exists and matches pattern ^\h*account\h+([^#\n\r]+)\h+pam_faillock\.so\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-auth exists and matches pattern ^\h*password\h+([^#\n\r]+)?\h+pam_unix\.so\h+([^#\n\r]+\h+)?sha512\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-password exists and matches pattern ^\h*password\h+([^#\n\r]+)?\h+pam_unix\.so\h+([^#\n\r]+\h+)?sha512\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-auth exists and matches pattern ^\h*password\h+[^#\n\r]+\h+pam_pwhistory\.so\h+([^#\n\r]+\h+)?remember=([5-9]|[1-9][0-9]+)\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-password exists and matches pattern ^\h*password\h+[^#\n\r]+\h+pam_pwhistory\.so\h+([^#\n\r]+\h+)?remember=([5-9]|[1-9][0-9]+)\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/login.defs exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*PASS_MAX_DAYS\h+(36[0-5]|3[0-5][0-9]|[1-2][0-9][0-9]|[1-9][0-9]|[2-9])\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/login.defs exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*PASS_MIN_DAYS\h+([1-9][0-9]*)\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/login.defs exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*PASS_WARN_AGE\h+([7-9]|[1-9][0-9]+)\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/default/useradd exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*INACTIVE\h*=\h*(30|[1-2][0-9]|[1-9])\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/login.defs exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*UMASK\h+(0[0-7][2-7]7|[0-7][2-7]7)(\h+.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/login.defs exists and matches pattern ^\h*(?i)USERGROUPS_ENAB\h*"?no"?(\h+.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-auth exists and matches pattern ^\h*session\h+(?:optional|requisite|required)\h+pam_umask\.so(\h+.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/password-auth exists and matches pattern ^\h*session\h+(?:optional|requisite|required)\h+pam_umask\.so(\h+.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/profile exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*UMASK\h+(0[0-7][2-7]7|[0-7][2-7]7|u=(r?|w?|x?)(r?|w?|x?)(r?|w?|x?),g=(r?x?|x?r?),o=)(\h+.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/bashrc exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*UMASK\h+(0[0-7][2-7]7|[0-7][2-7]7|u=(r?|w?|x?)(r?|w?|x?)(r?|w?|x?),g=(r?x?|x?r?),o=)(\h+.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/rsyslog.conf exists and matches pattern ^\s*\$FileCreateMode\s+0[6420][40]0\s*(\s+#.*)?$
Ensure no file named /etc/rsyslog.conf exists and matches pattern ^\s*\*\.\*\s+@
Ensure no file named /etc/passwd exists and matches pattern ^\h*[^:#\n\r]+:[^x:]*:[^:]*:[^:]*:[^:]*:[^:]*:[^:]*$

textfilecontent54_object.comment: Ensurefile(s) named ^.+$ in /etc/yum.repos.d exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*gpgcheck\h*=\h*(0|[2-9]|[1-9][0-9]+|false|no)\b
Ensurefile(s) named ^.+$ in /etc/yum.repos.d exists and matches pattern ^gpgcheck\h*=\h*0\b
Ensurefile(s) named ^.+$ in /etc/sudoers.d/ exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*([^#\n\r]+\h+)?\!authenticate\b(\.*)?$
Ensure no file(s) named ^.+\.conf$ in /etc/sudoers.d/ exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*defaults\h+(?:[^#\n\r]+\h*,\h*)?timestamp_timeout=(-1|1[6-9]|[2-9][0-9]|[1-9][0-9][0-9]+)\b(\h*,\h*.*)?$
Ensure at least one file(s) named ^.+\.sh$ in /etc/profile.d/ exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*UMASK\h+(0[0-7][2-7]7|[0-7][2-7]7|u=(r?|w?|x?)(r?|w?|x?)(r?|w?|x?),g=(r?x?|x?r?),o=)(\h+.*)?$
Ensure at least one file(s) named .*\.conf in /etc/rsyslog.d/ exists and matches pattern ^\s*\$FileCreateMode\s+0[6420][40]0\s*(\s+#.*)?$
Ensurefile(s) named .*\.conf in /etc/rsyslog.d/ exists and matches pattern ^\s*\*\.\*\s+@
Ensure at least one file named /etc/dnf/dnf.conf exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*gpgcheck\h*=\h*(1|true|yes)\b
Ensure no file named /etc/dnf/dnf.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*gpgcheck\h*=\h*(0|[2-9]|[1-9][0-9]+|false|no)\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/tdnf/tdnf.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*gpgcheck\h*=\h*1\h*$
Ensure no file named /etc/tdnf/tdnf.conf exists and matches pattern ^gpgcheck\h*=\h*0\h*(\h+.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/issue exists and matches pattern ^.+$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/issue.net exists and matches pattern ^.+$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/chrony.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*(server|pool|refclock)\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/sysconfig/chronyd exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*OPTIONS\h*=\h*"([^"#\n\r]+\h+)?-u\h_?chrony\b

textfilecontent54_object.comment: Ensure no file named /etc/sudoers exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*([^#\n\r]+\h+)?\!authenticate\b(\.*)?$
Ensure no file named /etc/sudoers exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*defaults\h+(?:[^#\n\r]+\h*,\h*)?timestamp_timeout=(-1|1[6-9]|[2-9][0-9]|[1-9][0-9][0-9]+)\b(\h*,\h*.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/pwquality.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*minlen\h*=\h*(1[4-9]|[2-9][0-9]|[1-9][0-9]{2,})\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-password exists and matches pattern ^\h*password\h+([^#\n\r]+\h+)?pam_pwquality\.so\h+([^#\n\r]+\h+)?(retry=[1-3])\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-auth exists and matches pattern ^\h*password\h+([^#\n\r]+\h+)?pam_pwquality\.so\h+([^#\n\r]+\h+)?(retry=[1-3])\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/pwquality.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*dcredit\h*=\h*-([1-9]|[1-9][0-9])+\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/pwquality.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*ucredit\h*=\h*-([1-9]|[1-9][0-9])+\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/pwquality.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*ocredit\h*=\h*-([1-9]|[1-9][0-9])+\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/pwquality.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*lcredit\h*=\h*-([1-9]|[1-9][0-9])+\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/pwquality.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*minclass\h*=\h*([1-9][0-9]+|[4-9])\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-auth exists and matches pattern ^\h*auth\h+([^#\n\r]+)\h+pam_faillock\.so([^#\n\r]+\h+)?deny=[1-5]\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-password exists and matches pattern ^\h*auth\h+([^#\n\r]+)\h+pam_faillock\.so([^#\n\r]+\h+)?deny=[1-5]\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-auth exists and matches pattern ^\h*auth\h+([^#\n\r]+)\h+pam_faillock\.so([^#\n\r]+\h+)?unlock_time=(0|9[0-9]{2}|[1-9][0-9]{3,})\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-password exists and matches pattern ^\h*auth\h+([^#\n\r]+)\h+pam_faillock\.so([^#\n\r]+\h+)?unlock_time=(0|9[0-9]{2}|[1-9][0-9]{3,})\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-auth exists and matches pattern ^\h*account\h+([^#\n\r]+)\h+pam_faillock\.so\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-password exists and matches pattern ^\h*account\h+([^#\n\r]+)\h+pam_faillock\.so\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-auth exists and matches pattern ^\h*password\h+([^#\n\r]+)?\h+pam_unix\.so\h+([^#\n\r]+\h+)?sha512\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-password exists and matches pattern ^\h*password\h+([^#\n\r]+)?\h+pam_unix\.so\h+([^#\n\r]+\h+)?sha512\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-auth exists and matches pattern ^\h*password\h+[^#\n\r]+\h+pam_pwhistory\.so\h+([^#\n\r]+\h+)?remember=([5-9]|[1-9][0-9]+)\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-password exists and matches pattern ^\h*password\h+[^#\n\r]+\h+pam_pwhistory\.so\h+([^#\n\r]+\h+)?remember=([5-9]|[1-9][0-9]+)\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/login.defs exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*PASS_MAX_DAYS\h+(36[0-5]|3[0-5][0-9]|[1-2][0-9][0-9]|[1-9][0-9]|[2-9])\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/login.defs exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*PASS_MIN_DAYS\h+([1-9][0-9]*)\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/login.defs exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*PASS_WARN_AGE\h+([7-9]|[1-9][0-9]+)\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/default/useradd exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*INACTIVE\h*=\h*(30|[1-2][0-9]|[1-9])\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/login.defs exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*UMASK\h+(0[0-7][2-7]7|[0-7][2-7]7)(\h+.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/login.defs exists and matches pattern ^\h*(?i)USERGROUPS_ENAB\h*"?no"?(\h+.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/system-auth exists and matches pattern ^\h*session\h+(?:optional|requisite|required)\h+pam_umask\.so(\h+.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/password-auth exists and matches pattern ^\h*session\h+(?:optional|requisite|required)\h+pam_umask\.so(\h+.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/profile exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*UMASK\h+(0[0-7][2-7]7|[0-7][2-7]7|u=(r?|w?|x?)(r?|w?|x?)(r?|w?|x?),g=(r?x?|x?r?),o=)(\h+.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/bashrc exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*UMASK\h+(0[0-7][2-7]7|[0-7][2-7]7|u=(r?|w?|x?)(r?|w?|x?)(r?|w?|x?),g=(r?x?|x?r?),o=)(\h+.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/rsyslog.conf exists and matches pattern ^\s*\$FileCreateMode\s+0[6420][40]0\s*(\s+#.*)?$
Ensure no file named /etc/rsyslog.conf exists and matches pattern ^\s*\*\.\*\s+@
Ensure no file named /etc/passwd exists and matches pattern ^\h*[^:#\n\r]+:[^x:]*:[^:]*:[^:]*:[^:]*:[^:]*:[^:]*$

external_variable.comment: This value is used in Rule: Ensure net-snmp is not installed or the snmpd service is not enabled

This value is used in Rule: Ensure rsync-daemon is not installed or the rsyncd service is masked
